name: Madhav Kumar Nepal
position: Former Prime Minister (2009–2011), Chairman of United Socialist Party
corruptionAllegations: Approved land acquisition exceeding legal limits for Patanjali Yogpeeth Nepal in Kavrepalanchok.
Allowed resale/swapping of land at inflated prices, reportedly causing a state loss of NPR 185 million.
First former Prime Minister formally charged by Nepal’s CIAA for corruption.
Also previously linked to the Lalita Niwas land-grab investigation involving land brokers and political collusion.
sources: CIAA filed case against Madhav Kumar Nepal and others in Patanjali land scandal; fine NPR 185M and possible 17-year sentence. name: Dev Kumar Nepali
corruptionAllegations: Founder and chairman of Image Savings and Credit Cooperative; accused of embezzling over NPR 2.25 billion from thousands of depositors.
Issued an international arrest warrant (Interpol Red Notice); arrested in New Delhi and extradited to Nepal in 2024.
Allegedly enjoyed initial political protection, delaying arrest.
